page.title: 11Farming, Fruit Growing
page.content: Fruit growing in this county is dominated by cider. The firm of H.P.Bulmer in Hereford is the largest cider producer in the world, and many orchards of cider apple varieties have been planted to supply it. These varieties are specifically for cider, not for eating, as they have high tannin and acid content. The trees are grown in grass and in the past were standard trees tall enough to allow sheep to graze beneath the branches. Nowadays bush trees are grown at a closer spacing. Mechanical harvesters are being developed. In addition to cider orchards, one fruit grower with 30 acres grows several varieties of apples and pears for sale from the farm, and also runs a Pick-your-own enterprise. Two other small market gardens supply the public with fruit and vegetables.
